messages.content: Write a passionate, despairing confession in the style of albert camus' the fall in which the speaker, in first person, confesses to getting trolled by children who kept beating him at halo until he got so mad that he threw his xbox controller against the wall and then sobbed when he realized he had broken it.

I cannot help but confess my shame and despair, for I have fallen victim to the most insidious of trolls - children who are no more than a fraction of my age. It all started innocently enough, with a simple game of Halo. At first, it was just harmless fun, a way to pass the time and escape the monotony of everyday life. But soon, I found myself consumed by a desire to win, to prove my worth and show these young upstarts who was truly in charge.

Alas, my efforts were in vain. Try as I might, I could not best these children, who seemed to possess an almost supernatural level of skill and cunning. Each defeat only fueled my rage and frustration, until I was in a state of blind fury, my mind consumed by thoughts of revenge.

And then it happened - in a fit of pure, unadulterated rage, I hurled my Xbox controller against the wall, the plastic casing shattering into a million pieces. It was then that the true extent of my folly became clear, as I collapsed to my knees in tears, realizing that I had let these children get the better of me, that I had been reduced to a mere shell of my former self.

In that moment, I felt as though I had lost not only the game, but my very soul. For what kind of person allows themselves to be so consumed by petty rivalries and childish competitiveness? What kind of person stoops so low as to lash out in anger and frustration, only to be left with nothing but regret and shame in its wake?

I know not what the future holds for me, but I cannot help but feel that I have lost something precious, something that can never be regained. For in my folly and weakness, I have allowed myself to be consumed by the very thing I sought to conquer - the foolish pride and vanity that leads so many astray.

He begs the reader to hate him as he hates himself, to see him in his despicable wretchedness.

Oh, how I wish I could undo what has been done! How I wish I could turn back the clock and erase the memory of my own wretchedness! But alas, such is not possible, and I am left with nothing but my own shame and despair.

For I, a grown man, have been trolled by mere children, who have bested me time and time again in the game of Halo. And what did I do in response? Did I take it in stride, swallow my pride, and strive to be a better player? No, I did not. I allowed myself to be consumed by rage and frustration, until I could take it no longer and hurled my Xbox controller against the wall.

And now, as I sit here in my own wretchedness, I beg of you, dear reader, to hate me as I hate myself. See me for what I truly am - a petty, foolish man, consumed by his own pride and vanity. Look upon me with disgust and disdain, for I deserve nothing less.

My actions have brought shame not only upon myself, but upon all of humanity. For what kind of species are we if we allow ourselves to be consumed by such petty rivalries and childish competitiveness? What kind of world are we creating for ourselves if we cannot even control our own emotions and impulses?

I know not what the future holds for me, but I can only hope that this confession will serve as a warning to others. Beware the folly of pride, dear reader, for it is a trap that can ensnare even the most virtuous of us. Do not follow in my footsteps, for they lead only to despair and regret.
